messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] psycho librarians ...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Lynda ... my h-s friend told me the head lib also told her that a teacher s aide abused the 6 wk privilege by checking out HARLEQUIN romance type books ...
messages.messageBody:
Hi Lynda ...

my h-s friend told me the head lib also told her that a teacher's aide
abused the 6 wk privilege by checking out HARLEQUIN romance type books ...
well, that's HER, not US!!!

after this gets ironed out, I've just resolved myself to the fact that I'll
use our downtown library (20 miles away in HEAVY traffic) instead of meeting
up w/ psycho~lib Lady and her cronies ... sheeze, it give me a headache just
thinking about going to *her* lib which is *ONLY* 5 miles away!!! no
thanks, I'd rather pay parking fees!!!

Pris

----- Original Message -----
From: Lynda <lurine@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, June 12, 2000 12:59 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] psycho librarians ...


> My question for the empty-head librarian is, do they allow ps teachers to
> choose what they wish to use for curriculum enhancing books or would they
> tell them that Kipling and the Redwall series are not appropriate also?
> And, what about kids who have assignments to check out book x,y or z? And
> what about the child that is sent to the library or even volunteers to
pick
> up books for a teacher? I've seen this happen when "Buddies" go and
choose
> books to be read to smaller children? Geez, this broad is out of control!
>
> Lynda
>
> ----------
> > From: Pris <x_t_sipr@...>
> > To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> > Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] psycho librarians ...
> > Date: Sunday, June 11, 2000 5:13 PM
> >
> > haha, I'll have to remember that statement *IN THE BOX*!!!
> >
> > well, here'z an update on my h-s'ing friend who decided to challenge the
> > library's policy on WHAT constituted TEACHING MATERIALS after my
horrible
> > experience earlier this week ... well, @ least I'm NOT crazy b/c the
same
> > thing happened to her only this time, the head lib was FLAILING (my
> friend's
> > words) her arms around and raising her voice in a very condescending
> manner
> > saying, "WHAT IS IT W/ YOU H-S P~E~O~P~L~E YOU ARE *ALWAYS* TRYING TO
GET
> > TAKE ADVANTAGE AND GET AROUND THE SYSTEM!!!" welllllllllllll, we've
> decided
> > to take the matter up w/ the higher~ups b/c this lady obviously has it
in
> > for h-s'rs ... even though, the other day she PROMISED to address this
> > matter in their staff meeting Monday morning (HA) ... either that or she
> was
> > pulling a Dr. Jeckle/Mrs. Hyde routine on my h-s friend b/c she was very
> > cooperative w/ me ... we're also decided it's time to get our local h-s
> > support group leadership involved, so, I'll keep ya'll posted (yes, I
> have a
> > heavy southern drawl) ...
> > Pris
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: B & T Simpson <michigan@...>
> > To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Saturday, June 10, 2000 10:16 AM
> > Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Redwall series???
> >
> >
> > >
> > > I'm In ! I took my kids to the library a few weeks back and gave my
> > daughter
> > > my teachers card to check out her mandi books on ( 5th grade chapter
> > books )
> > > the librarian told her she would have to check them out on her
personal
> > card
> > > because the teacher card was only for teaching items???? I said uh
> hello
> > we
> > > homeschool, as far as we are concerned everything they read is a
> teaching
> > > item! duh some people are just so how shall we say IN THE BOX! I am
> so
> > > glad to be out of it!!!!
> > > Tanya
> > > >
> > > >Redwall and Kipling aren't appropriate? What is that person smoking?
> > > >
> > > >Lynda, who hopes you find the head librarian and serve the other
one's
> > head
> > > >to them on a platter!
> > >
> >
> >

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] psycho librarians ...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 06/12/2000 12:12:45 AM !!!First Boot!!!, x_t_sipr@mindspring.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 06/12/2000 12:12:45 AM !!!First Boot!!!,
x_t_sipr@... writes:

<< the head lib was FLAILING (my friend's
words) her arms around and raising her voice in a very condescending manner
saying, "WHAT IS IT W/ YOU H-S P~E~O~P~L~E YOU ARE *ALWAYS* TRYING TO GET
TAKE ADVANTAGE AND GET AROUND THE SYSTEM!!!" welllllllllllll, we've decided
to take the matter up w/ the higher~ups b/c this lady obviously has it in
for h-s'rs ... >>


What porno was she trying to check out? :)

Nance

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] psycho librarians ...
messages.msgSnippet: My question for the empty-head librarian is, do they allow ps teachers to choose what they wish to use for curriculum enhancing books or would they tell them
messages.messageBody:
My question for the empty-head librarian is, do they allow ps teachers to
choose what they wish to use for curriculum enhancing books or would they
tell them that Kipling and the Redwall series are not appropriate also?
And, what about kids who have assignments to check out book x,y or z? And
what about the child that is sent to the library or even volunteers to pick
up books for a teacher? I've seen this happen when "Buddies" go and choose
books to be read to smaller children? Geez, this broad is out of control!

Lynda

----------
